text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zambian press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Frederick Chiluba says he has no intention of manipulating the constitution to enable him to run for a third term, but says he will sack party officials campaigning to succeed him.

- President Chiluba says miners are pleased with the appointment of former Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM) chief exucutive Francis Kaunda, as head of the government team in privatisation negotiations.
- Over 100 teachers protest at the Ministry of Finance to complain about overdue wages.

- Mining sources say major mining houses interested in buying into Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM) have rejected what they see as unrealistically high prices demanded by the government for the company's assets.
- A 13-year-old girl is suing her father for serious assault.
- Aid agencies have urged the government to declare the level of poverty in the country a national disaster.
